title: ‘SNL’ recap: Best moments from Nikki Glaser hosting ‘Saturday Night Live’
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Nikki Glaser hosted 'Saturday Night Live' on Nov. 8, marking the fifth episode of the show's 51st season.
Musical guest Sombr performed on the Nov. 8 episode hosted by comedian Nikki Glaser.
Highlights included Glaser's monologue, Sombr's performances, and Pete Davidson's return to the 'Weekend Update' desk.

title: Watch: Fraser Minten scores game-sealing goal for Bruins against his former team
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Fraser Minten scored a late insurance goal for the Boston Bruins in their 5-3 win against Toronto.
Minten was traded from Toronto to Boston last season, marking his first return since the trade.
With family in attendance, Minten's performance earned praise from Bruins coach Marco Sturm postgame.

title: Bruins legend Zdeno Chara describes ‘surreal’ induction into Hockey Hall of Fame
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Zdeno Chara was inducted into the Hockey Hall of Fame in Toronto during weekend festivities that began on Saturday.
Chara, a Stanley Cup champion and seven-time All-Star, spent 14 years as captain of the Boston Bruins.
Chara shares induction with former Bruin Joe Thornton, admired his Hall of Fame plaque as a humbling experience.

title: What insiders are predicting for the Red Sox in free agency this offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Red Sox are predicted to actively pursue top free agents, including Alex Bregman, Kyle Schwarber, and Pete Alonso.
Boston has $219 million committed in payroll, allowing flexibility for signings below the luxury tax threshold.
Potential contracts include six years, $171 million for Bregman and five years, $145 million for Schwarber.

title: Review & setlist: John Legend was a legendary pro at MGM Fenway (and he knew it)
author: Marc Hirsh
bullets: John Legend performed at MGM Music Hall in Boston, showcasing a versatile setlist spanning his 20-year career.
Legend incorporated covers and a medley of influences, blending gospel, R&B, and classic pop elements into his performance.
The concert highlighted Legend's confidence and musical range, ending with an encore featuring his hit 'All Of Me.'

title: Jaylen Brown seemingly criticizes officiating again following Celtics’ loss to Magic
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jaylen Brown criticized officiating after Celtics' 123-110 loss to the Magic, hinting at unfair calls in the fourth quarter.
Brown previously commented on officiating following a close 105-103 loss to the Jazz, emphasizing a missed foul call on Keyonte George.
Despite criticizing officials twice, Brown was not fined for his remarks after Monday's game against the Jazz.

title: 5 things to know about Buccaneers ahead of Sunday’s game vs. Patriots
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Buccaneers' quarterback Baker Mayfield has completed 63.9% of passes for 1,919 yards, 13 touchdowns, and 2 interceptions.
Rookie Emeka Egbuka has 562 receiving yards and five touchdowns, though he's been quiet in recent games due to injury.
Tampa Bay's defense ranks seventh in DVOA, with Jamel Dean and Antoine Winfield Jr. playing key roles.

title: Patriots’ return to relevance includes appearance by Jim Nantz in TV booth to call game for CBS
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Jim Nantz and Tony Romo will call the Patriots-Buccaneers game, their first Patriots game since 2023.
Nantz's return to broadcasting a Patriots game indicates New England's renewed relevance in the NFL.
The Patriots-Buccaneers game was chosen over Bills-Dolphins due to Miami's poor season performance.

title: Magic pull away, beat Celtics despite another big Jaylen Brown game: 8 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: The Boston Celtics lost 123-110 to the Orlando Magic, marking their first defeat in the NBA Cup this season.
Jaylen Brown scored 32 points on 15-for-28 shooting, continuing his high-level performance despite the Celtics' loss.
Payton Pritchard found his shooting form, making 5-of-8 from three-point range and scoring 27 points in the game.

title: Public reprimand recommended for judge accused of helping immigrant escape ICE
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Judge Shelley Joseph faces public reprimand for appearance of impropriety in a 2018 incident involving an immigrant's escape from ICE.
Hearing officer Denis J. McInerney found insufficient evidence that Judge Joseph was aware of or authorized the escape plan.
The reprimand follows dropped federal charges after Joseph agreed to a state agency investigation on alleged misconduct.
